channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - World
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2022 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: India and Pakistan heat wave is 'testing the limits of human survivability,' expert says
item.description: Temperatures in parts of India and Pakistan have reached record levels, putting the lives of millions at risk as the effects of the climate crisis are felt across the subcontinent.

item.title: China silences prominent market analyst as economic slump deepens
item.description: Chinese social media have shut down the accounts of a prominent market analyst who drew attention in recent weeks to the dramatic slowdown in the country's economy and the effects of government policy on the tech industry.

item.title: Why the food crisis sparked by Russia's war hasn't hit Gulf states yet
item.description: When Russia's invasion of Ukraine triggered an international food crisis, some Middle Eastern importers were hit particularly hard. An economically shattered Lebanon is fighting to avert a bread crisis, war-torn Yemen is already grappling with "alarming heights" of food insecurity, and Egypt, which last year imported 80% of its wheat from Russia and Ukraine, is capping bread prices to dodge hunger at home.

item.title: At least five Russian businessmen have died by apparent suicide in just three months
item.description: At least five prominent Russian businessmen have reportedly died by suicide since late January, with three of them allegedly killing members of their families before taking their own lives.

item.title: Buffett says Berkshire's success is more about being 'sane' than 'smart'
item.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has beaten the broader market so far this year. But the Oracle of Omaha wasn't willing to declare himself an investing genius during Saturday's annual shareholder meeting.

item.title: Electric car startups want to avoid same fate as Britain's 1890s bike bubble
item.description: Amazon and Ford reported this week they lost a combined $12.3 billion in the last three months due to their investments in electric vehicle company Rivian. The losses dampened hopes that any electric vehicle company will inevitably turn into gold.

item.title: The Fed's favorite inflation measure hit a fresh 40-year high
item.description: Americans had to reach deeper into their pockets in March, as yet another key inflation index showed prices hit a fresh 40-year high last month.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg just got $11.5 billion richer
item.description: Nearly two months after losing his spot among the world's 10 richest rich people, Mark Zuckerberg is clawing his way back.

item.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
item.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

item.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
item.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

item.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
item.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

item.title: 'Fountain of Exhaustion' sends powerful message about Ukraine
item.description: On the evening of February 24, just hours after Russia launched its full-blown attack on Ukraine, art curator Maria Lanko got into her car and left her home in Kyiv. Unsure of her exact plan, and with a potentially dangerous journey ahead, she packed only a few personal items into her trunk along with 78 bronze funnels belonging to one of the country's most important living artists, Pavlo Makov. Her mission was to drive them out of the country to safety.

item.title: Powerful photo by Pacific Indigenous artist reveals truth about 1899 painting
item.description: On an early morning in 2008, before the Metropolitan Museum of Art opened for the day, the artist Yuki Kihara sat down across from two paintings by the French artist Paul Gauguin and inspected them in the hushed, empty gallery.

item.title: Two of India's biggest celebrities tie the knot
item.description: Two of Bollywood's biggest stars, Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, tied the knot in Mumbai on Thursday in an intimate ceremony attended by some of the greats of Indian cinema.

item.title: Billionaire heiress Nicola Peltz marries Brooklyn Beckham in a decadent Valentino gown
item.description: Wedding season is officially open thanks to 27-year-old billionaire heiress and actress Nicola Peltz and 23-year-old Brooklyn Beckham -- eldest son of British football player David Beckham and former Spice Girl-turned-designer Victoria Beckham -- who tied the knot this weekend at the Peltz family's Palm Beach Estate in Florida.

item.title: The world's skinniest skyscraper completes
item.description: The world's skinniest skyscraper has been completed, adding a new landmark to Manhattan's famous skyline.

item.title: Japanese photographer's family portraits are literally breathtaking
item.description: Having a family portrait taken by Haruhiko Kawaguchi comes with one unusual condition: That he wrap your entire house in plastic and then vacuum-seal you into an airtight bag.

item.title: 30 classic Italian dishes that everyone should try
Unusual airlines that really existed
item.description: In the late 1970s, the US government deregulated the airline industry, removing federal control over fares, routes and the entry of new airlines into the market.

item.title: Can the world's largest plane ever fly again?
item.description: The images of the wrecked Antonov AN-225 are now an indelible memory for aviation enthusiasts worldwide.

item.title: The summer of travel chaos just got more chaotic
item.description: Temperatures are rising, Covid cases are falling, restrictions are dropping away in the blink of an eye and summer vacations are so close you can smell the sunscreen. But getting away this year won't be easy or relaxing.

item.title: He bought a cruise ship on Craigslist. Here's what happened next
item.description: It's not every day that you spot a cruise ship for sale on Craigslist. So Chris Willson was immediately intrigued when he stumbled across a 293-foot vessel listed on the classified advertisements website back in 2008.

item.title: Sign up for our 9-part Italy travel and food newsletter
CNN Hero of the Year Shirley Raines has more to give to the 'Kings' and 'Queens' of Skid Row
item.description: When Shirley Raines was named the 2021 CNN Hero of the Year in New York City last December, she wasted no time bringing the honor back to her Skid Row community in Los Angeles.

item.title: The Ukrainian refugee crisis is the latest mission for a CNN Hero, who leads teams of mobile medics responding to global disasters
item.description: People around the globe have been moved by the horrible images of Ukrainians in distress, fleeing their homes after the Russian invasion began in late February. But the scope of the situation can be difficult to comprehend.

item.title: CNN Heroes salutes the strength and courage of Ukraine
item.description: As the Ukrainian people fight for their democracy and their lives amidst the Russian invasion, we share this tribute to their heroism, scored to John Legend's "Never Break."

item.title: 2022 Best Car Insurance. Find the top insurance companies
0% intro APR until nearly 2024 is 100% insane
It's official: now avoid credit card interest into 2024
